content: behold man’s nature w/out looking at man (look away from thinking?)
linkedContent: behold man’s nature w/out looking at man (look away from thinking?)

content: thinking understood traditionally, as re-presenting, a kind of willing > like Kant, who calls thinking spontaneity: to think is to will, to will to think

content: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me

content: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

content: if only I possessed (hätte) already the right releasement (Gelassenheit) [can one possess releasement?], could wean from willing, freed of task of weaning
linkedContent: if only I possessed (hätte) already the right releasement (Gelassenheit) [can one possess releasement?], could wean from willing, freed of task of weaning

content: don’t awaken Gelassenheit in ourselves on our own > is letting-be a kind of passivity? perhaps a higher acting concealed in Gelassenheit? Gelassenheit beyond distinction activity/passivity > transition from willing into Gelassenheit seems difficult

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: don’t awaken Gelassenheit in ourselves on our own > is letting-be a kind of passivity? perhaps a higher acting concealed in Gelassenheit? Gelassenheit beyond distinction activity/passivity > transition from willing into Gelassenheit seems difficult

content: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path
linkedContent: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path

content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

content: other side of horizon as a region, enchanted region: “where everything belonging there returns in that in which it rests” > openness as a region, the region of regions, the region

linkedContent: other side of horizon as a region, enchanted region: “where everything belonging there returns in that in which it rests” > openness as a region, the region of regions, the region

content: the region gathers, each to each, while resting in itself: “regioning is a gathering and re-sheltering (versammelnde Zurückbergen) for an expanded resting (Beruhen) in an abiding (Weile)” [Gegnet], in Gegnet, openness is halted and held [Derrida beyond Heidegger]

linkedContent: the region gathers, each to each, while resting in itself: “regioning is a gathering and re-sheltering (versammelnde Zurückbergen) for an expanded resting (Beruhen) in an abiding (Weile)” [Gegnet], in Gegnet, openness is halted and held [Derrida beyond Heidegger]

content: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]
linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]

content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]
linkedContent: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

content: waiting (warten) is not awaiting (erwarten): done waiting when we represent what we are waiting for > remaining is a returning > openness itself is Gegnet, into which we’re released by waiting when we think > thinking: coming-into-the-nearness of distance > how come you suddenly could wait?

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: waiting (warten) is not awaiting (erwarten): done waiting when we represent what we are waiting for > remaining is a returning > openness itself is Gegnet, into which we’re released by waiting when we think > thinking: coming-into-the-nearness of distance > how come you suddenly could wait?

content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]
linkedContent: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

content: a mysterious region where there’s nothing for which to be answerable [?] > because it’s the region of the word, answerable to itself alone > everything in best order, in region we stay, if it was no one’s doing
linkedContent: a mysterious region where there’s nothing for which to be answerable [?] > because it’s the region of the word, answerable to itself alone > everything in best order, in region we stay, if it was no one’s doing

content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

content: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)
linkedContent: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)

content: man released to Gegnet in his being, he originally belongs to it, appropriated (ge-eignet) originally to Gegnet, through this itself [?]
linkedContent: man released to Gegnet in his being, he originally belongs to it, appropriated (ge-eignet) originally to Gegnet, through this itself [?]

content: waiting (upon opening of Gegnet) = Gelassenheit—is waiting named adequately? [cf. p. 72]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: waiting (upon opening of Gegnet) = Gelassenheit—is waiting named adequately? [cf. p. 72]

content: thinking changes in Gelassenheit from re-presenting to waiting upon Gegnet > scientist: I can follow this, but I can represent nothing of it
linkedContent: thinking changes in Gelassenheit from re-presenting to waiting upon Gegnet > scientist: I can follow this, but I can represent nothing of it

content: we are already appropriated to Gegnet [so why wait?] > a restless to and fro btwn yes/no, suspended (hängen) btwn the 2, our stand in this betweenness (diesem Zwischen) [cf. Introduction to Metaphysics…stand in contradiction (p.82?)] is waiting > we presage (ahnen) [cf. Basic Concepts] the nature of thinking as releasement (only to forget Gelassenheit again) > thinking isn’t self-subsisting releasement: it’s the regioning of releasement, releasing releasement into Gegnet
linkedContent: we are already appropriated to Gegnet [so why wait?] > a restless to and fro btwn yes/no, suspended (hängen) btwn the 2, our stand in this betweenness (diesem Zwischen) [cf. Introduction to Metaphysics…stand in contradiction (p.82?)] is waiting > we presage (ahnen) [cf. Basic Concepts] the nature of thinking as releasement (only to forget Gelassenheit again) > thinking isn’t self-subsisting releasement: it’s the regioning of releasement, releasing releasement into Gegnet

content: regioning of Gegnet w/ respect to man can’t be same as reigioning of Gegnet w/ respect to things? [cf. 77] > regioning of Gegnet doesn’t cause/effect things or Gelassenheit
linkedContent: regioning of Gegnet w/ respect to man can’t be same as reigioning of Gegnet w/ respect to things? [cf. 77] > regioning of Gegnet doesn’t cause/effect things or Gelassenheit

content: objects, things-in-themselves: such terminology freezes thought > “after that scholarly reservation, you shouldn’t hesitate to speak in a scholarly manner”
linkedContent: objects, things-in-themselves: such terminology freezes thought > “after that scholarly reservation, you shouldn’t hesitate to speak in a scholarly manner”

content: relation btwn Gegnet and Gelassenheit, neither ontic nor ontological: only thought as regioning
linkedContent: relation btwn Gegnet and Gelassenheit, neither ontic nor ontological: only thought as regioning

content: relation of Gegnet to thing: determining (Bedingnis) (not making/effecting or rendering possible) > to learn [to hear] determining must wait upon it & regioning w/ respect to man
linkedContent: relation of Gegnet to thing: determining (Bedingnis) (not making/effecting or rendering possible) > to learn [to hear] determining must wait upon it & regioning w/ respect to man

content: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]
linkedContent: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]

content: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet
linkedContent: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet

content: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]
linkedContent: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]

content: [will as cause & effect] every will wants to actualize, have actuality as its element > the risk that Gelassenheit sounds like the denial of the will to live [Schopenhauer] > power of action & resolve also reign in Gelassenheit [these will mistakenly seem to pertain to will]
linkedContent: [will as cause & effect] every will wants to actualize, have actuality as its element > the risk that Gelassenheit sounds like the denial of the will to live [Schopenhauer] > power of action & resolve also reign in Gelassenheit [these will mistakenly seem to pertain to will]

content: steadfastness (Ausdauer) hidden in Gelassenheit: Gelassenheit becomes increasingly clearer about its inner nature, being steadfast, stands w/in this > the composure (Verhaltenheit) of Gelassenheit > could correspond to highest willing, but could not > “in-dwelling (Inständigkeit)”
linkedContent: steadfastness (Ausdauer) hidden in Gelassenheit: Gelassenheit becomes increasingly clearer about its inner nature, being steadfast, stands w/in this > the composure (Verhaltenheit) of Gelassenheit > could correspond to highest willing, but could not > “in-dwelling (Inständigkeit)”

content: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]
linkedContent: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]

content: man thinks, is released—to that which is prior to everything > man is released to Gegnet because this release belongs essentially to Gegnet, can’t be a coming forth of all natures w/out man [Being needs man] > can’t be conceived so long as we represent it to ourselves [can we avoid representational thought/writing?]
linkedContent: man thinks, is released—to that which is prior to everything > man is released to Gegnet because this release belongs essentially to Gegnet, can’t be a coming forth of all natures w/out man [Being needs man] > can’t be conceived so long as we represent it to ourselves [can we avoid representational thought/writing?]

content: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth
linkedContent: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth

content: abiding in his origin, man drawn to what is noble (in his nature): presentiment (Vermuten) of the noble mind > patience extends the furthest, waits the longest [arrival?] > [summary] “a patient noble-mindedness would be pure resting in itself of that willing, which, renouncing willing, has released itself to what is not will” > that which thanks for being allowed to thank [thanks nothing]
linkedContent: abiding in his origin, man drawn to what is noble (in his nature): presentiment (Vermuten) of the noble mind > patience extends the furthest, waits the longest [arrival?] > [summary] “a patient noble-mindedness would be pure resting in itself of that willing, which, renouncing willing, has released itself to what is not will” > that which thanks for being allowed to thank [thanks nothing]

content: we have said everything in mode of supposition only [still on path]
linkedContent: we have said everything in mode of supposition only [still on path]

content: coming near & remaining distant from Gegnet > such remaining is a returning > Gegnet would be nearing & distancing > Genet itself: nearness of distance, distance of nearness
linkedContent: coming near & remaining distant from Gegnet > such remaining is a returning > Gegnet would be nearing & distancing > Genet itself: nearness of distance, distance of nearness

content: nature of thinking can’t be said in a single word [still on path] > [scholar now keeps a word he is thinking secret, momentarily] was not my discovery, merely a scholarly thought: a historical reminder

content: Heraclitus’ agchibasiē: “going near,” “letting-oneself-into-nearness,” “moving into nearness,” the name/best name for what we’ve found?
linkedContent: Heraclitus’ agchibasiē: “going near,” “letting-oneself-into-nearness,” “moving into nearness,” the name/best name for what we’ve found?

content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called
